snippet: A court ruled that the first name of the girl, Blaer Bjarkardottir, could be used, overturning a decision by officials who declared that Blaer was not a proper feminine name.
abstract: District court in Reykjavik, Iceland, rules that Blaer Bjarkardottir can legally use name given to her by her mother, overturning decision by officials that Blaer, which means light breeze, is not proper feminine name.
lead_paragraph: A court ruled that the first name of the girl, Blaer Bjarkardottir, could be used, overturning a decision by officials who declared that Blaer was not a proper feminine name.

headline.main: In Iceland, Court Says a Girl Can Finally Use Her Name
headline.print_headline: Iceland: Court Says a Girl Can Finally Use Her Name
